channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Planned Parenthood in Wisconsin stops abortions due to rule that threatens funding
item.description: Planned Parenthood in Wisconsin has stopped performing abortions even though they're legal in that state because of a new rule that stops Medicaid funding for clinics that provide abortion.
item.content:encoded: Planned Parenthood in Wisconsin has stopped performing abortions even though they're legal in that state because of a new rule that stops Medicaid funding for clinics that provide abortion.
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: A 1919 film featuring Nez Perce tribal members was recently re-discovered in Idaho
item.description: After being lost in a Soviet vault for decades, the first feature film made in Idaho, in 1919, is now returning to screens. It includes significant depictions of Nez Perce tribal members.
item.content:encoded: After being lost in a Soviet vault for decades, the first feature film made in Idaho, in 1919, is now returning to screens. It includes significant depictions of Nez Perce tribal members.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Paterson

item.title: Supreme Court hears case on LGBTQ conversion therapy ban
item.description: The U.S. Supreme Court appeared skeptical today about Colorado's ban on conversion therapy for minors. About half the states have such laws.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. Supreme Court appeared skeptical today about Colorado's ban on conversion therapy for minors. About half the states have such laws.
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: More college students are using AI for class. Their professors aren't far behind
item.description: More college students are using AI chatbots to help them with their studies. But data recently released by an AI company shows they're aren't the only ones using the technology.
item.content:encoded: More college students are using AI chatbots to help them with their studies. But data recently released by an AI company shows they're aren't the only ones using the technology.

item.title: What to know about getting an updated COVID-19 vaccine
item.description: Now that the CDC has finally issued final guidelines for the updated COVID-19 vaccines, at least some of the confusion on eligibility should clear up.
item.content:encoded: Now that the CDC has finally issued final guidelines for the updated COVID-19 vaccines, at least some of the confusion on eligibility should clear up.
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein

item.title: Air traffic control delays ripple across U.S. for a 2nd day amid government shutdown
item.description: A shortage of air traffic controllers led to delays last night at airports serving New York, Los Angeles and Denver. It's one of several ways the government shutdown could impact commercial aviation.
item.content:encoded: A shortage of air traffic controllers led to delays last night at airports serving New York, Los Angeles and Denver. It's one of several ways the government shutdown could impact commercial aviation.
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: The costs of Israel's longest war, for Israelis
item.description: Israelis are paying heavy costs for the longest war in their history: a mental health crisis, trauma, unprecedented division during wartime, animosity abroad and apathy for Palestinian suffering.
item.content:encoded:
Israelis are paying heavy costs for the longest war in their history: a mental health crisis, trauma, unprecedented division during wartime, animosity abroad and apathy for Palestinian suffering.

(Image credit: John Wessels)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: As birds migrate south, there's an invisible danger: glass
item.description: A huge threat to migrating birds is colliding with a building. Now birding groups are banding together with government agencies and others to form one united front to tackle the problem.
item.content:encoded: A huge threat to migrating birds is colliding with a building. Now birding groups are banding together with government agencies and others to form one united front to tackle the problem.
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Patients turn to 'gray market' for cheaper obesity drugs, but it's risky
item.description: Patients who want a deeper discount on obesity meds than compounding pharmacies can offer are turning to the gray market, where they buy the raw active ingredient from China and prepare it themselves.
item.content:encoded: Patients who want a deeper discount on obesity meds than compounding pharmacies can offer are turning to the gray market, where they buy the raw active ingredient from China and prepare it themselves.
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: After education funding cuts, Texas churches expand English classes for some students
item.description: Some protestant churches in Texas are quietly embracing a new mission: providing ESL instruction to immigrants. Baptist churches in Plano, Waco and Austin say they're seeing rising enrollment.
item.content:encoded: Some protestant churches in Texas are quietly embracing a new mission: providing ESL instruction to immigrants. Baptist churches in Plano, Waco and Austin say they're seeing rising enrollment.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Asch
